some bonus things like your tests will automatically run you don't need to ask somebody to start your start your test
running after a while again building trust you'll move up to be an official
reviewer for a part of the code base and then eventually improver which will give you commit rights over a specific

sub-project owners not only have control direct control
over the code but are involved in discussions as far as setting like architectural direction uh and making

know well staffed and and has what it needs so
for many the biggest hurdle is going from either a non-member to a

group mentoring cohorts that are usually specifically focused on a specific area
or need within the project where you know a small group of folks maybe
like 10 or 15 folks will be mentored with the goal of some of them becoming a
reviewer becoming a member at the end of the at the end of the cycle if they they stick with it
